title: Graph of sampling distribution for size 40

content.description: The graph shows the population distribution of random variable <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>X</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> with mean <math alttext="85" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following graphs is a sampling distribution of the sample mean <math alttext="x bar" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>Â¯</mo> </mrow> </mover> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> for samples of size <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> taken from the population?

choices.label: The figure presents a histogram with 10 bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled x bar, and the numbers 20 through 110, in increments of 10, are indicated. There is one bar for each number on the horizontal axis. The distribution is left-skewed with a center around 85.

The figure presents a histogram with 9 bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled x bar, and the numbers 72 through 96, in increments of 2, are indicated. The bars begin at 76 and end at 92. The distribution is unimodal, symmetric, and mound-shaped with a center around 85.

The figure presents a histogram with 5 bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled x bar, and the numbers 83, 85, and 87 are indicated. The bars begin at 83 and end at 87. The distribution is unimodal, symmetric, and mound-shaped with a center at 85.

The figure presents a histogram with 9 bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled x bar, and the numbers 58 through 74, in increments of 2, are indicated. There is one bar on each number on the horizontal axis. The distribution is unimodal, symmetric, and mound-shaped with a center around 66.

The figure presents a histogram with 9 bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled x bar, and the numbers 10 through 90, in increments of 10, are indicated. There is one bar for each number on the horizontal axis. The distribution is right-skewed with a center around 35.

content.answer: The figure presents a histogram with 9 bars of data. The horizontal axis is labeled x bar, and the numbers 72 through 96, in increments of 2, are indicated. The bars begin at 76 and end at 92. The distribution is unimodal, symmetric, and mound-shaped with a center around 85.
